title: Vice Chairman of Dubai Supreme Council of Energy receives US Department of Energy delegation
text:
(MENAFN - Emirates News Agency (WAM)) DUBAI 29th September 2015 (WAM) -- Saeed Mohammed Al Tayer Vice-Chairman of the Dubai Supreme Council of Energy and MD and CEO of Dubai Electricity and Water Authority DEWA has received a delegation headed by Dr. Elizabeth Sherwood-Randall Deputy Secretary at the US Department of Energy. 
The delegation also included Barbara A. Leaf US Ambassador to the UAE Paul R. Malik Consul-General at the US Consulate in Dubai and Adam Seminsky Administrator of the US Energy Information Administration EIA. 
The meeting was attended by Fatima Al Foora Al Shamsi Assistant Under-Secretary for Electricity Clean Energy and Desalinated Water Affairs at the Ministry of Energy Ahmed Butti Al Muhairbi Secretary-General of the Dubai Supreme Council of Energy in Dubai Waleed Salman Executive Vice President of Strategy and Business Development at DEWA Dr. Yousef Al Akraf Executive Vice President of Business Support and Human Resources at DEWA Stephane Le Gentil CEO of Etihad Energy Services Company Etihad ESCO and a number of officials from the Supreme Council of Energy and DEWA. 
The visit aimed to build closers ties with a review of DEWA's strategic projects and discussions on preparations for hosting Solar Decathlon Middle East SDME in 2018 and 2020 in Dubai the first international college team competition to take place in the Middle East. The competition is organised by the US Department of Energy to design smart solar-powered buildings using sustainable building materials. It targets all universities around the world. 
Al Tayer welcomed the delegation emphasising that such meetings support DEWA's commitment to share best global practices and expertise with its partners in sustainability. He highlighted the strategic projects and programmes and achievements of both the Supreme Council of Energy and DEWA which support the Green Economy for Sustainable Development initiative launched by Vice President and Prime Minister and Ruler of Dubai His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum and the Dubai Plan 2021 to build a sustainable environment and future and promote Dubai's leading position as a global hub for trade finance tourism and sustainability. 
Al Tayer presented some of DEWA's mega-projects including the Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Solar Park. The Solar Park includes a research and development centre for innovative research in energy and water in Dubai. It conducts studies on industrial and social needs and leadership in scientific research. It also works as a link between researchers and developers and comes up with strategies for productive innovative ideas. He also highlighted the Hassyan Clean-Coal Project the expansion of the M-Station power and desalination plant which is the largest and newest electricity generation and water desalination station in the UAE the smart grids project DEWA's three smart initiatives which support the Smart Dubai Initiative. Also covered were the key projects and strategic initiatives that DEWA is implementing to support the Dubai Integrated Energy Strategy 2030 to diversify the energy mix and reduce energy demand by using best global practices in resource rationalisation and protection. 
Al Tayer noted that DEWA is working to achieve the directives of the wise leadership and has reached significant milestones in energy efficiency green buildings and retrofitting of existing buildings. Over 30000 buildings will be retrofitted by 2030. He also briefed the delegation about DEWA's energy and water conservation campaigns. 
The US delegation expressed its interest in participating in DEWA's projects especially clean energy projects exchanging expertise and technologies and contributing to Dubai's sustainable growth. 
The two sides discussed hosting the first and second Solar Decathlon competition in 2018 and in 2020 in Dubai in conjunction with Expo 2020. University teams from around the world will be invited to design build and operate solar-powered houses that are cost-effective energy-efficient attractive and focus on protecting the environment. Hosting the Solar Decathlon is also a practical implementation of the Dubai Integrated Energy Strategy 2030 to diversify energy sources and increase the percentage of renewable energy in Dubai's energy mix to 15% by 2030. 
Dr. Sherwood-Randall noted that her government will provide full support to ensure the success of the hosting of this global competition in Dubai as well as promoting collaboration in energy research and innovation. She emphasised that the partnership will foster collaboration among students from different academic disciplines including engineering and architectural students and pave the way for development creativity and innovation in these fields. 
The two sides also discussed preparations for an intended visit this coming October where a delegation from the Dubai Supreme Council of Energy headed by Al Tayer will visit the USA to look at the latest practices and experiences in infrastructure projects on solar energy renewable energy clean coal smart grids and carbon emission reductions. 
The delegation will review events to be held on the sidelines of the competition in which DEWA will participate. During the visit the delegation will officially launch the competition.
